idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.0.0.532

descript.abstract: U.S. Census Feature Class Codes (table) represents the United States Bureau of the Census feature classifications. The Census feature class codes (also called FCC) are used in many data sets.
descript.purpose: U.S. Census Feature Class Codes (table) displays Census feature class codes attributes. Join this table to any table with Fcc or Cfcc attributes as the common field.

idinfo.useconst:
The data are provided by multiple, third party data vendors under license to ESRI for inclusion on ESRI Data & Maps for use with ESRI® software. Each data vendor has its own data licensing policies and may grant varying redistribution rights to end users. Please consult the redistribution rights below for this data set provided on ESRI Data & Maps. As used herein, “Geodata” shall mean any digital data set consisting of geographic data coordinates and associated attributes.
The redistribution rights for this data set: Public domain data from U.S. government is freely redistributable with proper metadata and source attribution.
The terms and conditions below apply to all the data sets provided on ESRI Data & Maps.
Proprietary Rights and Copyright: Licensee acknowledges that the Data and Related Materials contain proprietary and confidential property of ESRI and its licensor(s). The Data and Related Materials are owned by ESRI and its licensor(s) and are protected by United States copyright laws and applicable international copyright treaties and/or conventions.
Limited Warranty and Disclaimer: ESRI warrants that the media upon which the Data and Related Materials are provided will be free from defects in materials and workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of receipt.
THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS ARE EXCLUDED FROM THE LIMITED WARRANTY, AND THE LICENSEE EXPRESSLY ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THE DATA CONTAINS SOME NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS. ESRI DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE DATA WILL MEET LICENSEE'S NEEDS OR EXPECTATIONS; THAT THE USE OF THE DATA WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED; OR THAT ALL NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS CAN OR WILL BE CORRECTED. ESRI IS NOT INVITING RELIANCE ON THIS DATA, AND THE LICENSEE SHOULD ALWAYS VERIFY ACTUAL DATA.
EXCEPT FOR THE LIMITED WARRANTY SET FORTH ABOVE, THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS CONTAINED THEREIN ARE PROVIDED "AS-IS," WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
Exclusive Remedy and Limitation of Liability: The entire liability of ESRI or its licensor(s) and Licensee's exclusive remedy shall be to terminate the Agreement upon Licensee returning the Data and Related Materials to ESRI with a copy of Licensee's invoice/receipt and ESRI returning the license fees paid to Licensee.
IN NO EVENT SHALL ESRI AND/OR ITS LICENSOR(S) BE LIABLE FOR COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOST PROFITS, LOST SALES, OR BUSINESS EXPENDITURES, INVESTMENTS, OR COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH ANY BUSINESS; LOSS OF ANY GOODWILL; OR FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR USE OF THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS, HOWEVER CAUSED, ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, AND WHETHER OR NOT ESRI OR ITS LICENSOR(S) HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THESE LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY EXCLUSIVE REMEDY.
Third Party Beneficiary: ESRI's licensor(s) has (have) authorized ESRI to (sub)distribute and (sub)license its (their) data as incorporated into the Data and Related Materials. As an intended third party beneficiary to this Agreement, the ESRI licensor(s) is (are) entitled to directly enforce, in its own name, the rights and obligations undertaken by the Licensee and to seek all legal and equitable remedies as are afforded to ESRI.
In the event that the data vendor(s) has (have) granted the end user permission to redistribute the Geodata, please use proper proprietary or copyright attribution for the various data vendor(s), and provide the associated metadata file(s) with the Geodata. In compliance with FGDC metadata standards, ESRI has attempted to practice proper metadata methodologies by providing any data source information, descriptions, and file names to assist in this effort.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact Technical Support by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 909-793-3774; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contactint.cfm.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

enttyp.enttypd: The table represents the United States Bureau of the Census feature classifications.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The Census feature class code. The code is three characters; the first character is a letter describing the feature class; the second character is a number describing the major category; and the third character is a number describing the minor category.
The description of the Census feature class code.

digtinfo.formspec: The DBF file contains the attribute data in dBASE® format. The XML file (*.dbf.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI® software.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the ESRI Telesales staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contactint.cfm.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports dBASE® files.

citeinfo.title: Census Feature Class Codes (table)
citeinfo.othercit: The Census Feature Class Codes (table) is derived from the Census 2000 TIGER/Line 2000 documentation.

procstep.procdesc:
The following steps were performed by ESRI for Data & Maps 2002: Updated the table from the Census 2000 TIGER/Line® documentation.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted data set from Department of Commerce, Census Bureau media. Converted from delimited text file format to dBASE file format.

citeinfo.title: GDT Feature Class Codes

serinfo.sername: GDT Product Documentation - Documentation on CD-ROM

citeinfo.othercit: GDT Feature Class Codes is part of GDT Product Documentation (Documentation on CD–ROM) under Reference Documents.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated the table to include all codes found in the GDT Feature Class Code (FCC) list. No codes were removed.

dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for number of records, attribute names, and values compared with source materials.

distorOrdPrc.ordInstr:
ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI® software.
In the United States, contact the ESRI Telesales staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contactint.cfm.
distorOrdPrc.resFees: Software purchase price. ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI® software. To use this data requires software that supports dBASE® files.

dataLineage.statement:
Census FCC (source 1 of 2)
Department of Commerce, Census Bureau, 2000, Census Feature Class Codes (table): Department of Commerce, Census Bureau, USA.
Other citation details: The Census Feature Class Codes (table) is derived from the Census 2000 TIGER/Line 2000 documentation.
Type of source media: CD–ROM Source contribution: Attribute data
GDT FCC (source 2 of 2)
Geographic Data Technology, Inc., 20031024, GDT Feature Class Codes: GDT Product Documentation - Documentation on CD-ROM 2004, Geographic Data Technology, Inc, Lebanon, New Hampshire, USA.
Other citation details: GDT Feature Class Codes is part of GDT Product Documentation (Documentation on CD–ROM) under Reference Documents.
Type of source media: CD–ROM Source contribution: Attribute data
Date: 20011213 (change 1 of 2) The following steps were performed by ESRI for Data & Maps 2002: Updated the table from the Census 2000 TIGER/Line® documentation.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted data set from Department of Commerce, Census Bureau media. Converted from delimited text file format to dBASE file format.
Data sources used in this process: Census FCC
Date: 20040316 (change 2 of 2) The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated the table to include all codes found in the GDT Feature Class Code (FCC) list. No codes were removed.
Data sources used in this process: GDT FCC
